metadata.feature_description: Manages file metadata including title, description, tags, and system attributes like archive, hidden, read-only

steps.action: Navigate to Assets and open file details for cavalier-logo.png
steps.expected: File details panel opens showing editable fields
steps.actual: File details panel opened with Name, Title, Description, Tags, and attribute fields visible

steps.action: Enter 'Cavalier Company Logo' in the Title field
steps.actual: Title field successfully updated with 'Cavalier Company Logo'

steps.action: Enter description text in the Description field
steps.actual: Description field successfully updated with 'This is the official Cavalier Electronics company logo used for branding purposes.'

steps.action: Type 'logo' in the Tags field and press Enter
steps.expected: Tag 'logo' is added to the file
steps.actual: Tag 'logo' was successfully added and displayed as a tag chip

steps.action: Type 'branding' in the Tags field and press Enter
steps.expected: Tag 'branding' is added to the file
steps.actual: Tag 'branding' was successfully added alongside 'logo' tag

steps.action: Click the remove (x) button on the 'branding' tag
steps.expected: Tag 'branding' is removed from the file
steps.actual: Tag 'branding' was successfully removed, only 'logo' tag remains

steps.action: Toggle the Archive attribute from On to Off
steps.expected: Archive attribute toggle changes to Off state
steps.actual: Archive attribute successfully toggled to Off

steps.action: Toggle the Hidden attribute from Off to On
steps.expected: Hidden attribute toggle changes to On state
steps.actual: Hidden attribute successfully toggled to On

steps.action: Toggle the Read-Only attribute from Off to On
steps.expected: Read-Only attribute toggle changes to On state
steps.actual: Read-Only attribute successfully toggled to On

steps.action: Toggle the System attribute from Off to On
steps.expected: System attribute toggle changes to On state
steps.actual: System attribute successfully toggled to On

steps.action: Toggle the Publish Period from Off to On
steps.expected: Publish Period toggle enables and shows Start Date and End Date fields
steps.actual: Publish Period enabled and date fields appeared with Start Date defaulting to file creation date (12/27/2025)

steps.action: Click End Date field and select January 31, 2026 from date picker
steps.expected: End Date is set to selected date
steps.actual: End Date successfully set to 1/31/2026 using the date picker calendar

steps.action: Observe required field indicators in the file details panel
steps.expected: Required fields are marked with asterisk (*)
steps.actual: Name field is marked as required with asterisk (Name *). The field validation is enforced by the UI.

steps.action: Click Save button to save all metadata changes
steps.actual: Save completed successfully, panel closed and returned to file list

steps.action: Reopen file details to verify saved data
steps.expected: All previously entered metadata is retained
steps.actual: All metadata (Title, Description, Tags, Attributes) was correctly persisted and retrieved

observations: The file details panel opens via hover action revealing action buttons - direct clicking on file cards triggers file download instead
File attributes (Archive, Hidden, Read-Only, System) appear to use Windows file system attributes when supported
Hidden attribute does not hide files from admin users in the Assets panel - likely only affects non-admin visibility
Publish Period feature uses a date picker calendar for selecting start and end dates
Tags are displayed as removable chips with an 'x' button for deletion
